page.title: 08The George Inn
page.content: The George Inn built in the eighteenth century took its name from the King. It is situated at the top of Portsdown Hill with splendid views over the city of Portsmouth and beyond. It is believed to have been a 'drag' station stabling horses that were used to help stage coaches up the hill. The original small rooms downstairs have been cleared to make open areas but some original beams and brickwork remain. The inn was popular with cyclists and in 1967, following extensive roadworks nearby, has been mainly popular with local people.
